intro: Calyptranthes enneantha, commonly known as the nine-lobed calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
